intro: Psychotria pumila, commonly known as the dwarf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. This plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Psychotria pumila is also known for its use in traditional medicine and its role in the ecological systems of its native habitats.
